title: Customers say the darndest things, episode 1
body:
Before I begin this series, let me begin by prefacing it with this: The Moxie is a business run by a guy (and his wife) who happens to write a blog that is read by millions and millions of people looking for a good laugh. Be warned, if you visit our theater and say or do something that most people would deem "stupid," you may get written about on the blog.

The majority of our customers don't have to worry about being written about, but for those of you who do... fear not. Your identity will be masked behind the veil of a generic moniker, such as "guy 1" or "girl A," or maybe even "Mr. Stinky Stinkerton." So, without further ado, let me recount verbatim (or as close to it as I can get) a conversation I had with two customers earlier today.

GUY 1: Does this "Murderball" have obscenities in it?
DAN: Cussing?
GUY 1: Yes. Curse words, sex, nudity... that kind of garbage.
DAN: Well, there is cussing. And the rugby players do discuss their sex lives, in light of their condition, in a humorous manner, but nothing that I'd consider offensive.
GUY 1: Hmm.
GUY 2: You know. I don't have a problem watching an R-rated film, or even an X-rated one, as long as it doesn't have any cussing or nudity or fighting.
DAN: Well, unfortunately, we don't show X-rated movies here.
GUY 2: Really? Hmm.
GUY 1: Hmm.
DAN: I hope to see you both at "Murderball" tomorrow!

And scene. Uh oh, time for a reel change!
author: Dan

comments.author: matt
comments.body: there was a restaurant here in atlanta that put stupid or funny customer sayings on the wall.  they had some real gems up there because they served international fusion burritos so people were often confused "is this a mexican place or a chinese place?"... that sort of thing.  i can't think of any of them right now and the place has closed, but it had some honest-to-goodness laugh out loud quotes.  might make for good bathroom decoration for the moxie.
